channel.title: Does anyone have "Jill of the jungle"
channel.description:
This was one of the absolute coolest Dos games! i broke my floppy of it this morning and i was wondering if anyone has a copy of it im not looking for a emulated copy im looking for the actual dos files sense i still have a dos machine i screw around on every so often
[img]http://ben.bacchus.com.au/vpcblog/images/jill4.PNG[/img]
thats a emulation of it but sometimes pictures help you remember
[b]Some other dos classics im looking for[/b] Wolf pack for dos Wolfenstien 3d (beavis and butthead patch) i have the actual game also known as the barny patch and dukenukem 1 and 2 not the 3d versions but the side scrollers
again im not looking for emulations im looking for the actual install files for the real game

item.title: Does anyone have "Jill of the jungle"
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

poor duke… he shall always live in my memories… i dont remember ever beating the game… i was like 7 when i played it, like running around the same level for hours was good enough for me.

Read full topic
item.source: Does anyone have "Jill of the jungle"

item.title: Does anyone have "Jill of the jungle"
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

eXemplar:

david: http://duke.a-13.net/

Things that have taken less time than Duke Nukem Forever's Development: Pop Culture: 
* The Beatles formed, released every single one of their albums and broke up. During this time they also toured the world several times.
* Led Zeppelin released 7 albums, 9 singles, and toured around the world, crossing international borders 27 times (not counting mainland Europe.)

Science & Technology:

* The Wright brothers designed and flew the first airplane.
* The theory of General Relativity.
* The United States' entire program to put a man on the moon, from Kennedy's challenge to the landing.

Wars:

* The American War for Independence
* The United States Civil War
* World War I
* World War II and the entire Manhattan Project.
* The United State's involvement in the Vietnam War.</blockquote>

Holy shit!

Read full topic
item.source: Does anyone have "Jill of the jungle"

item.title: Does anyone have "Jill of the jungle"
item.dc:creator: @yetanothercheater yetanothercheater
item.description:
@yetanothercheater wrote:

It’s possible to find all three episodes of Jill of the Jungle online. I remember getting them probably a year ago or so, beating them, and deleting them. You’ll probably have to look at abandonware or warez sites, or just make educated guesses about what the files are called (I’m pretty sure they were some sort of archives).

Read full topic
item.source: Does anyone have "Jill of the jungle"

item.title: Does anyone have "Jill of the jungle"
item.dc:creator: @doomsday doomsday
item.description:
@doomsday wrote:

James, i used to play DOS games, but the thing is that, now days we have extreme graphial games(like oblivion) and compared to Jill of the Jungle, it’s like comparing 1D to 4D, but i do like some DOS games, but i prefer the games to look like real life(or as close to it as possible).

item.title: Does anyone have "Jill of the jungle"
item.dc:creator: @james james
item.description:
@james wrote:

[quote=“doomsday, post:12, topic:3619”]how can anyone like dos???

  1. the scripting allows very little to happen
  2. the graphics? WOW, can you say none?
  3. and the sound effects? crappy[/quote]
    look rly dos games own. Jill of the jungle i played when i was like 9 it was so sick. I havent finished it yet :’( . Any fucker who judges a game by its graphics really dont look into the overall enjoyment of the game.

doomsday:ok dos games sound cool lets play one
opens up game
OMG GRAPHICS SUCK IM OUT OF IT

Read full topic

item.title: Does anyone have "Jill of the jungle"
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

how can anyone like dos????
  1. the scripting allows very little to happen
  2. the graphics? WOW, can you say none?
  3. and the sound effects? crappy

You obviously don’t know anything about DOS, or video games. Saying very little happens in DOS is like saying you have a very large dick, because when you say either one, you are lying.

Read full topic
item.source: Does anyone have "Jill of the jungle"

item.title: Does anyone have "Jill of the jungle"
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“doomsday, post:12, topic:3619”]how can anyone like dos???

  1. the scripting allows very little to happen
  2. the graphics? WOW, can you say none?
  3. and the sound effects? crappy[/quote]

I love dos,
My machine with dos only has 2 mb of ram, yet it is a thousand times faster then my computer with a gig of ram.

But in most cases, we like it because it’s vintage. And many of us grew up on dos, such as me. Who cares about the grapihcs, there are a lot of amazing dos games. If all you look for in games are graphics and sound, then why are you on a runescape related website?

Read full topic
item.source: Does anyone have "Jill of the jungle"

item.title: Does anyone have "Jill of the jungle"
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“PaulT, post:4, topic:3619”]Holy fuck yes I have this game.

This is one of my favorite games of all time. If you liked this, you should definetely try Xargon, which is like Jill of the Jungle, times a million.[/quote]

Omg I fucking love Xargon. Been playing that since i was a kid, still havn’t beaten it >.<

My fav dos game ever = Castles OR Leisure larry, arnyone play these? edit** Oh and Commander keen

Dos rules, now Im excited to go to my cottage just so that I can play some old games.
